variant.name: .Extension
variant.summary: A port opened to an extension context.

variant.name: .NativeApp
variant.summary: A port opened to a native application.

variant.name: .Tab
variant.summary: A port opened to a tab context.

variant.name: .MD
variant.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 10/2020.

variant.name: .Uber
variant.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 04/2018.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActionSetIconFailureType
histogram.summary: The cause for the failure in the setIcon() extension API function. This is temporary logging to help track down the cause of a crash.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.DeniedExtensions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions on a page that wanted to execute a script, required explicit user consent, and were denied permission.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.PermittedExtensions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions on a page that wanted to execute a script, required explicit user consent, and were granted permission.

histogram.name: Extensions.ApiBindingGenerationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to generate the JavaScript API bindings for a particular extension API. This includes the time from when a JavaScript context tries to access the API, triggering the lazy initializion, to the time when the API object is returned. This is only recorded if the binding is successfully generated. See also Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_*.

histogram.name: Extensions.ApiBindingObjectGenerationTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of time it takes to create the JavaScript binding object using the binding.js module. This is a strict subset of Extensions.ApiBindingGenerationTime, which includes this work and more.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Extensions.ApiTabUpdateJavascript
histogram.summary: Reports whether a tab was updated to a javascript:-scheme URL from the extensions tabs.update API. Reported once per call to tabs.update().

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of times v1 apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Apps.AppLaunch for v2 apps.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunchSource
histogram.summary: The number of times apps are launched grouped by extensions::AppLaunchSource.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLoadedInTab
histogram.summary: A platform app ended up in a regular tab either by the app page or its background page. Note that this happens unexpectedly right now and we wish to track its usage before removing the supporting code.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLocation
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppsPromo
histogram.summary: The actions taken in the NTP apps promo grouped by extension_misc::AppsPromoBuckets.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppTabLaunchType
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched grouped by extensions::LaunchType.

histogram.name: Extensions.AttemptedToDowngradeVersionLocation
histogram.summary: The extension install location of an extension that Chrome attempted to add, but failed because it would downgrade the version. Tracking for https://crbug.com/810799.

histogram.name: Extensions.AttemptedToDowngradeVersionType
histogram.summary: The extension item type of an extension that Chrome attempted to add, but failed because it would downgrade the version. Tracking for https://crbug.com/810799.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageLoadTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken for an extension's persistent background page to load its initial URL.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageType
histogram.summary: The type (if any) of background page the extension has. Recorded for installed extensions on startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.BadMessageFunctionName
histogram.summary: The number of times each Extension function call sends a bad message, killing the renderer. This may indicate a bug in that API's implementation on the renderer. Note a similar, aggregate metric is BadMessageTerminate_EFD which counts the number of bad messages that are sent overall.

histogram.name: Extensions.BadSyncDataReason
histogram.summary: The reason a valid ExtensionSyncData could not be parsed from a SyncData received from sync.

histogram.name: Extensions.Bindings.NativeBindingCreationTime
histogram.summary:
The elapsed time to create a new full instance of an extension API's bindings using native bindings.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Extensions.Bindings.UpdateBindingsForContextTime{ExtensionContextType}
histogram.summary:
The elapsed time to update the bindings for a new or existing v8::Context. The suffix indicates which type of context the bindings are for.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution. {ExtensionContextType}

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkAppLaunchContainer
histogram.summary: Records the container used for a web app launch, when the app is launched (eg. via UI surfaces or intents). Not recorded when the web app is navigated to via URL.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkAppLaunchSource
histogram.summary: The number of times web apps are launched, grouped by extensions::AppLaunchSource. The equivalent histogram on Android is called Launch.HomeScreenSource.

histogram.name: Extensions.CheckForExternalUpdatesTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionService::CheckForExternalUpdates.

histogram.name: Extensions.Checkup.NtpPromoClicked
histogram.summary: Records every time the user clicks on the extensions checkup middle slot promo link. The user is served the promo if they are part of the ExtensionsCheckup experiment and have at least one non default installed extension. The promo should appear every time the user opens the NTP. The enum value represents the focus of the message displayed in the promo, which is determined by the experiment group the user is in. This metric should be compared with Extensions.Checkup.NtpPromoShown.

histogram.name: Extensions.Checkup.NtpPromoShown
histogram.summary: Records every time the user is served the extensions checkup middle slot promo on the NTP. The user is served the promo if they are part of the ExtensionsCheckup experiment and have at least one non default installed extension. The promo should appear every time the user opens the NTP. The enum value represents the focus of the message displayed in the promo, which is determined by the experiment group the user is in. This metric should be compared with Extensions.Checkup.NtpPromoClicked.

histogram.name: Extensions.Checkup.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: The amount of time passed from when the chrome://extensions page has finished loading till it is closed. We record the time elapsed once the WebUI has been destroyed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ChromeExtensionsClientInitTime2
histogram.summary: The amount of elapsed time taken to initialize the ChromeExtensionsClient. Recorded once per client initialization, which happens once per instance of Chrome. This is a new stat that has microsecond resolution.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.ComputedHashesInitTime
histogram.summary: How long a successful initialization of computed_hashes.json file takes. Recorded when content verification needs to retrieve block hashes.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.ComputedHashesReadResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not computed_hashes.json file read and parse succeeded. Recorded when content verification needs to retrieve block hashes.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.ComputeHashesOnInstallResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not computed_hashes.json file was successfully generated and written during extension installation. Recorded during installation of an extension if hashes computing was requested for this specifix extension. Hashes computing on installation is used for off-store policy-based extensions since we need them to be checked against corruption and cannot use Chrome Web Store for source of hashes.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.ComputeHashesOnInstallTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to successfully create the computed_hashes.json file for an extension upon installation. The histogram is collected with &Extensions.ContentVerification.ComputeHashesOnInstallResult& (in case of success).

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.FetchFailureError
histogram.summary: Error info for fetching verified_contents.json. Recorded when the file wasn't available locally and we failed to fetch it from network. Note that OK may also be reported in some cases, for example, when file was successfully fetched, but is incorrect.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not fetching verified_contents.json succeeded. Recorded when the file wasn't available locally and we needed to fetch it from network.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.ReadContentHashTime
histogram.summary: Time spent by ContentVerifier for a request to create a ContentHash instance. Recorded during an extension load completion or during an on demand content verification that was triggered by ContentVerifyJob.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.VerifiedContentsInitResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not initializing verified_contents.json succeeded. Recorded during an extension load completion or during an on demand content verification that was triggered by ContentVerifyJob.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContentVerification.VerifiedContentsInitTime
histogram.summary: How long a successful initialization of verified_contents.json file takes. Recorded if Extensions.ContentVerification.VerifiedContentsInitResult = true was recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.ContextMenuAction
histogram.summary: Records the action taken by the user from the extension icon context menu.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptedExtensionLocation
histogram.summary: Records the manifest location of a corrupted extension that will be reinstalled silently. Fires when we suspect corruption in an extension and begin the process of reinstalling it.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionBecameDisabled
histogram.summary: Fired each time an extension was detected to be corrupted (contents not matching an expected content hash from the webstore) and was disabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionDisabledReason
histogram.summary: The reason why an extension was detected to be corrupted. Recorded each time an extension is disabled due to corruption detection.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionTotalDisables
histogram.summary: Logged once at startup, this is the value of a counter that is incremented anytime we disable a corrupted extension because its content didn't match an expected content hash.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionWouldBeDisabled
histogram.summary: Simiar to Extensions.CorruptExtensionBecameDisabled, but fires when we're in a bootstrapping mode and would have disabled an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionDetected3
histogram.summary: Fires when we suspect corruption in an enterprise policy forced install extension and begin the process of reinstalling it, saving reason of such suspection. Compare to CorruptPolicyExtensionResolved to judge success rate. Note that if extension was not reinstalled in the session when corruption was found, it will be detected again (possible several times, every session start will trigger a detection until the extension will be fixed), but as CORRUPTION_DETECTED_IN_PRIOR_SESSION.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionResolved
histogram.summary: Fires when we've successfully resinstalled a corrupt enterprise policy force-installed extension, with a value indicating how long it took end-to-end to complete the reinstall (including download time).

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Database.Restore
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to recover from an attempt to open a database that failed as a result of corruption.

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Open{ExtensionsDatabaseOpen}
histogram.summary: The result of an open attempt to an Extensions database. {ExtensionsDatabaseOpen}

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Value.Restore
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to delete a corrupted value from a database.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeAPIFunctionCalls
histogram.summary: Number of calls to the declarative API extension functions. This includes the declarativeContent and declarativeWebRequest APIs. Emitted when the extension function is called.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeContentActionCreated
histogram.summary: Number of times a declarative content action is created within an extension. Emitted when a new declarative content action is created.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.CreateVerifiedMatcherTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken to load a single indexed ruleset in the browser process for an extension. This includes reading the indexed ruleset file and verifying it. Emitted whenever a single file-backed extension ruleset is loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateBeforeRequestTime.SingleExtension2
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate the before-request action for a network request for a single extension ruleset. Emitted for each network request that is visible to the extension. This is only emitted for users with high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateRequestTime.AllExtensions3
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate the action to take for the network request as per the Declarative Net Request API. This includes the time taken to evaluate all the extension rulesets. Emitted for non-sensitive network requests seen by the Extension System when there is at least one active extension ruleset. This is only emitted for users with high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.IndexAndPersistRulesTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to index and persist to disk, the deserialized json rules provided by an extension manifest for the Declarative Net Request API. This is emitted whenever a packaged extension with a declarative ruleset is installed or updated.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.IsLargeRegexRule
histogram.summary: Logs whether a regex rule wasn't indexed since it exceeded the per-rule memory limit. Emitted for every regex rule an extension adds.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.LoadRulesetResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of loading an extension ruleset for the Declarative Net Request API. Emitted whenever a single extension ruleset is loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ManifestEnabledRulesCount2
histogram.summary: The number of enabled indexed declarative rules provided by an extension manifest for the Declarative Net Request API. This is emitted whenever a packaged extension with a declarative ruleset is installed or updated.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ManifestRulesCount2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 08/2021.
histogram.summary: The number of indexed declarative rules provided by an extension manifest for the Declarative Net Request API. This also includes rules from disabled rulesets. This is emitted whenever a packaged extension with a declarative ruleset is installed or updated.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ReadDynamicRulesJSONStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates the result of reading the dynamic JSON rules for an extension from the disk. Logged whenever an extension calls the getDynamicRules extension function or when it updates the dynamic rules through a call to addDynamicRules or removeDynamicRules.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.RequestHeaderAdded
histogram.summary: Records the request header added by extensions using the DeclarativeNetRequest API. Recorded for each network request during the OnBeforeSendHeaders stage. Multiple samples can be recorded per request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.RequestHeaderChanged
histogram.summary: Records the request header modified by extensions using the DeclarativeNetRequest API. Recorded for each network request during the OnBeforeSendHeaders stage. Multiple samples can be recorded per request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.RequestHeaderRemoved
histogram.summary: Records the request header removed by extensions using the DeclarativeNetRequest API. Recorded for each network request during the OnBeforeSendHeaders stage. Multiple samples can be recorded per request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ResponseHeaderAdded
histogram.summary: Records the response header added by extensions using the DeclarativeNetRequest API. Recorded for each network request during the OnHeadersReceived stage. Multiple samples can be recorded per request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ResponseHeaderChanged
histogram.summary: Records the response header modified by extensions using the DeclarativeNetRequest API. Recorded for each network request during the OnHeadersReceived stage. Multiple samples can be recorded per request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ResponseHeaderRemoved
histogram.summary: Records the response header removed by extensions using the DeclarativeNetRequest API. Recorded for each network request during the OnHeadersReceived stage. Multiple samples can be recorded per request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.RulesetReindexSuccessful
histogram.summary: Indicates whether reindexing of a Declarative Net Request ruleset was successful. Called whenever a JSON ruleset for an extension is reindexed, e.g. on ruleset corruption. Note: this is emitted for both static and dynamic rulesets.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.UpdateDynamicRulesStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates the result of an extension function call to add or remove dynamic rules. Logged every time an extension calls the addDynamicRules or removeDynamicRules extension function.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeRulesStorageInitialization
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent until rules storage delegate gets ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeSetIconWasVisible
histogram.summary: Reports whether an icon specified in the declarativeContent.SetIcon API is considered visible by our icon analysis code. This stat is emitted when we create the underlying object that sets the icon when the declarative rule is applied.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeSetIconWasVisibleRendered
histogram.summary:
Reports whether an icon specified in the declarativeContent.SetIcon API is considered visible by our icon analysis code. This stat is emitted when we create the underlying object that sets the icon when the declarative rule is applied.
This replaces the previous stat, DeclarativeSetIconWasVisibleRendered, due to a change to our analysis algorithm. The new algorithm renders the icon against the toolbar background color and determines how visible the resulting pixels are.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_Blessed
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per blessed extension context (chrome-extension://... origins within Extension processes, like background pages, options pages, popups).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_BlessedWebPage
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per blessed web page context (hosted apps).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_ContentScript
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per content script context.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_LockScreenExtension
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per content script context. This histogram measures the time to install Extension Javascript bindings in a context for a platform app enabled on the Chrome OS lock screen.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_Unblessed
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per unblessed extension context (chrome-extension://... origins hosted in iframes).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_Unspecified
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings in an unknown type of context (this should never happen other than in bizarre circumstances).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_WebPage
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per web page context (just the chrome.app, chrome.webstore, and possibly chrome.runtime APIs).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_WebUI
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per WebUI context (chrome://extensions and so forth).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidInitializeServiceWorkerContextOnWorkerThread
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per service worker context.

histogram.name: Extensions.Disabled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are disabled at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledForPermissions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are disabled at browser startup due to permissions increases.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse2
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions. A count is recorded when the user takes an action on the dialog (re-enable or remove the extension) or ignores the dialog.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall2
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to it having been installed remotely. A count is recorded when the user takes an action on the dialog (re-enable or remove the extension) or ignores the dialog.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisableReason
histogram.summary: The count of disabled extensions at startup grouped by disble reason from disable_reason::DisableReason. When an extension is disabled, it can be for one or more reasons (although typically just one), so the sum of these may be greater than 'Extensions.Disabled' which is a count of the number of unique extensions that are disabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.DynamicExtensionActionIconWasVisible
histogram.summary: Reports whether a call to set a dynamic icon in the toolbar passed an icon considered visible by our icon analysis code.

histogram.name: Extensions.DynamicExtensionActionIconWasVisibleRendered
histogram.summary:
Reports whether a call to set a dynamic icon in the toolbar passed an icon considered visible by our icon analysis code.
This replaces the previous stat, DynamicExtensionActionIconWasVisible, due to a change to our analysis algorithm. The new algorithm renders the icon against the toolbar background color and determines how visible the resulting pixels are.

histogram.name: Extensions.ErrorCodeFromCrxOpen
histogram.summary: If opening the CRX file for unpacking fails, this integer is the error code given by the OS.

histogram.name: Extensions.EsbAllowlistOmahaAttribute
histogram.summary: Reports the value of the Safe Browsing CRX allowlist custom omaha attribute when an update check occurs for an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventlessEventPages
Extensions.EventPageActiveTime2
histogram.summary: The time between an extension's event page loading its first URL and the event page later shutting down.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageIdleTime
histogram.summary: The time an extension's event page has spent unloaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageLoadTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken for an extension's event page to load its initial URL.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.Dispatch
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchToComponent
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to a *component* extension. Otherwise identical to Extensions.Events.Dispatched.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithPersistentBackgroundPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension with a persistent background page. The event may or may not have been dispatched to the background page itself, for example it may have been dispatched to its popup. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithRunningEventPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension with an event page that was already running (i.e. at some point had been woken from its suspended state, see Extensions.Events.DispatchWithSuspendedEventPage). The event may or may not have been dispatched to the event page itself, for example it may have been dispatched to its popup. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithServiceWorkerBackground
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to a service worker based extension background context. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithSuspendedEventPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension with an event page that was suspended. This implies that firing this event woke up the event page. The event may or may not have been dispatched to the event page itself, for example it may have been dispatched to its popup, but regardless it will wake the event page. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionAddDisabledRemotelyReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M92 and replaced with Extensions.ExtensionAddDisabledRemotelyReason2.
histogram.summary: Recorded when a new violation is retrieved from Omaha for an extension. The new violation reason is retrieved from the update service data key reasons during an update check for extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionAddDisabledRemotelyReason2
histogram.summary: Recorded when a new violation is retrieved from Omaha for an extension. The new violation reason is retrieved from the update service data key reasons during an update check for extensions. This metric was added in M92 to replace the old version, because the logic of logging greylisted extensions has changed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCacheCount
histogram.summary: Number of cached extensions on disk. Reported on Chrome OS during user session start.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCacheSize
histogram.summary: Total size of .crx files in cache on disk. Reported on Chrome OS during user session start.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionDisabledRemotely
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M92 and replaced with Extensions.ExtensionDisabledRemotely2.
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension that was previously enabled is disabled due to a new violation retrieved from Omaha. This is recorded when the violation is detected when Chrome checks for an update for the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionDisabledRemotely2
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension that was previously enabled is disabled due to a new violation retrieved from Omaha. This is recorded when the violation is detected when Chrome checks for an update for the extension. This metric was added in M92 to replace the old version, because the logic of logging greylisted extensions has changed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionInstalled
histogram.summary: Emitted when an extension is downloaded by the user (including webstore installs).

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionLocation
histogram.summary: The install location for a given extension. Recorded once per enabled extension on profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionReenabledRemotely
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension that was previously only disabled remotely is re-enabled remotely during an update service session.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionReenabledRemotely{BlocklistState}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a {BlocklistState} extension that was previously only disabled remotely is re-enabled remotely during an update service session.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionRootPathLength
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Length of the Extensions dir path inside the profile directory.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime
histogram.summary: Time taken for the ExtensionService to initialize, including the time it takes to load the extensions for the service's profile and parse their manifests. This happens during startup and also any time a new profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionServiceNotifyReadyListenersTime
histogram.summary: Time taken for the ExtensionService to notify all ready listeners that the extension system is now ready. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUninstalled
histogram.summary: An extension has been uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalExtensionEvent{ExternalExtensionEvent}
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records what happens to extensions that are sideloaded, grouped by the ExternalExtensionEvent enum. {ExternalExtensionEvent}

variant.name: NonWebstore
variant.summary: sideloaded extensions that don't update from the webstore

variant.name: Webstore
variant.summary: sideloaded extensions that update from the webstore

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalItemState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of sideloaded apps/extensions loaded on startup grouped by enabled/disabled state.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalJsonCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.FaviconResourceRequested
histogram.summary: Records when an extension with the chrome://favicon host permission makes a network level request for a favicon resource.

histogram.name: Extensions.FeatureProviderStaticInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during extensions::FeatureProvider::Static. Only measured while in the browser process.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileAccessAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been given access to the file:// scheme, and were, for users that have at least one extension that could have been given access. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.FileAccessNotAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileAccessNotAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been given access to the file:// scheme, but weren't, for users that have at least one extension that could have been given access. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.FileAccessAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledAndBlackListed
histogram.summary: Number of enterprise policy forced extensions that are blacklisted and thus not loaded after 5 minutes if at least one of policy forced extensions is not yet enabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledCacheStatus
histogram.summary: Status of cache entry about enterprise policy forced extension. Recorded for each forced extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledCreationStage
histogram.summary: The last known intermediate stage of extension when the extension installation stage if CREATED if failure reason was not recorded (installation of an extension was neither yet finished nor failed). Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledDownloadingStage
histogram.summary: The last known downloading stage of extension downloading process if failure reason was not recorded and installing stage is DOWNLOADING, so it's specification of Extensions.ForceInstalledStage. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureCacheStatus
histogram.summary: Status of cache entry about enterprise policy forced extension which failed to install. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureCrxInstallError
histogram.summary: Detailed reason why CRX installation failed for enterprise policy forced extensions. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.{OffStore,Webstore}_ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to CRX_INSTALL_ERROR_*.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureManifestInvalidAppStatusError
histogram.summary: The detailed reason why enterprise policy forced extensions had failed to install because fetched update manifest was invalid due to app status error. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason2 equal to MANIFEST_INVALID and Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureManifestInvalidErrorDetail2 equal to BAD_APP_STATUS.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureNoUpdatesInfo
histogram.summary: The info field in the update manifest fetched from the server for enterprise policy forced extensions. Recorded for each forced extension for which the server responds with no updates and an empty CRX fetch url. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.{OffStore,WebStore}_ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to CRX_FETCH_URL_EMPTY.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason3
histogram.summary:
The reason why enterprise policy forced extensions were not installed. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.
Replaced Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason2 because of reporting MANIFEST_INVALID instead of MANIFEST_FETCH_FAILED in case parsing update manifest failed with different reasons for the extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSandboxUnpackFailureReason
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 02/2021 in favour of `Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSandboxUnpackFailureReason2`.
histogram.summary: The reason why enterprise policy forced extensions had failed to unpack. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to CRX_INSTALL_ERROR_SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSandboxUnpackFailureReason2
histogram.summary:
The reason why enterprise policy forced extensions had failed to unpack. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to CRX_INSTALL_ERROR_SANDBOXED_UNPACKER_FAILURE.
Replaced Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSandboxUnpackFailureReason because the enum values were not in sync with the C++ enums.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSessionType{FailureReason}
histogram.summary: The type of session in case enterprise policy forced extensions were not installed. Recorded for each force installed extension which failed to install after 5 minutes. Supported only on ChromeOS and recorded only if there is an active user. {FailureReason}

variant.name: .ExtensionStuckInInitialCreationStage
variant.summary: Extensions stuck in NOTIFIED_FROM_MANAGEMENT_INITIAL_CREATION_FORCED stage. Replaced ".ExtensionStuckInCreatedStage" variant as the histogram collects data about extensions stuck in NOTIFIED_FROM_MANAGEMENT_INITIAL_CREATION_FORCED stage but the name suggested that the data is collected for extensions stuck in CREATED stage.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureStuckInCreatedStageAreExtensionsEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether the extensions are enabled or not. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledCreationStage equal to NOTIFIED_FROM_MANAGEMENT_INITIAL_CREATION_FORCED.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureStuckInInitialCreationStageAreExtensionsEnabled
histogram.summary:
Records whether the extensions are enabled or not. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledCreationStage equal to NOTIFIED_FROM_MANAGEMENT_INITIAL_CREATION_FORCED.
Replaced "Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureStuckInCreatedStageAreExtensionsEnabled" because the histogram collects data about extensions stuck in NOTIFIED_FROM_MANAGEMENT_INITIAL_CREATION_FORCED stage but the name suggested that the data is collected for extensions stuck in CREATED stage.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureWithCrxHeaderInvalidIsCWS
histogram.summary: Records whether the extension is from the Chrome Web Store or not. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSandboxUnpackFailureReason equal to CRX_HEADER_INVALID.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureWithCrxHeaderInvalidIsFromCache
histogram.summary: Records whether the extension is downloaded from cache or not. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureSandboxUnpackFailureReason equal to CRX_HEADER_INVALID.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed during installation of enterprise policy forced extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledNotLoadedDisableReason
histogram.summary: Records the disable reason for the enterpise policy forced extensions. Recorded for each forced extension that installed but failed to load after 5 minutes. If the extension is not disabled, it records DisableReason::DISABLE_NONE.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledReadyTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed for enterprise policy forced extensions to become ready for use.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledSessionsWithNonMisconfigurationFailureOccured
histogram.summary: Records whether there was a possible non-misconfiguration failure for the enterprise policy forced extensions. Records true if in a session at least one forced extension failed to install after 5 minutes with a non-misconfiguration failure and false when all the forced extensions which failed to install after 5 minutes failed due to some misconfiguration. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledStage2
histogram.summary:
The last known stage of extension installation process if failure reason was not recorded (installation of an extension was neither yet finished nor failed). Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.
Replaced Extensions.ForceInstalledStage because the stages that were used for used for investigation of CREATED stage are moved to a new enum.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutAndNotInstalledCount
histogram.summary: Number of enterprise policy forced extensions that are not installed after 5 minutes if at least one of policy forced extensions is not yet enabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount
histogram.summary: Number of enterprise policy forced extensions that are not loaded after 5 minutes timeout, while might be already installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledTime{ExtensionInstallStages}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

variant.name: .CheckingExpectationsStartTo.FinalizingStart
variant.summary: Time taken to perform the expectations checks to confirm that the extension can be installed.

variant.name: .CopyingStartTo.UnpackingStart
variant.summary: Time taken to complete copying of extension archive into the working directory

variant.name: .DownloadingStartTo.ManifestDownloadComplete
variant.summary: Time taken to complete download of update manifest

variant.name: .FinalizingStartTo.CRXInstallComplete
variant.summary: Time taken to complete the installation of the unpacked extension.

variant.name: .ManifestDownloadCompleteTo.CRXDownloadComplete
variant.summary: Time taken to complete download of CRX

variant.name: .UnpackingStartTo.CheckingExpectationsStart
variant.summary: Time taken to complete the unpacking of the extension archive.

variant.name: .VerificationStartTo.CopyingStart
variant.summary: Time taken to complete signature verification of CRX

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledTotalCandidateCount
histogram.summary: Total amount of extensions in force installed list. Gets recorded on profile open (which happens on every startup and when user logs in) and tries to load extensions. Number of records should correspond to the sum of records in "Extensions.ForceInstalledLoadTime" and records in "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutAndNotInstalledCount".

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalled{ErrorType}FetchTries
histogram.summary: Number of fetch retries made when enterprise policy forced extensions failed to install with {ErrorType}. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.`OffStore,Webstore`_ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to {ErrorType}.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalled{ErrorType}NetworkErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error code for the last retry attempt when CRX fetch failed for enterprise policy forced extensions failed to install due to {ErrorType}. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.`OffStore,WebStore`_ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to {ErrorType}.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceToolbarPinnedCount
histogram.summary: Number of extensions that are "force-pinned" in the ExtensionSettings policy. Recorded after policies are parsed, or refreshed. Only recorded if non-zero.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceToolbarPinnedCount2
histogram.summary: Number of force installed extensions that are "force-pinned" in the ExtensionSettings policy. Recorded after policies are parsed, or refreshed. Only recorded if non-zero.

histogram.name: Extensions.FromWebstoreInconsistency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of apps/extensions loaded on startup with an inconsistent "from webstore" state. This means an item that is flagged as from_webstore, but with either a non-webstore update_url or an external install location.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.ComponentExtensionCalls
histogram.summary: Recorded when a component extension calls an extension API. Recorded once per function call. See also Extensions.Functions.WebUICalls, Extensions.Functions.WebUIUntrustedCalls, and Extensions.Functions.ExtensionCalls.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.ExtensionCalls
histogram.summary: Recorded when a non-component extension calls an extension API. Recorded once per function call. See also Extensions.Functions.WebUICalls, Extensions.Functions.WebUIUntrustedCalls, and Extensions.Functions.ComponentExtensionCalls.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.ExtensionServiceWorkerCalls
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension service worker calls an extension API. Note that the function would also be included in either Extensions.Functions.ExtensionCalls or Extensions.Functions.ComponentExtensionCalls histogram.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.FailedTime{ExtensionFunctionExecutionTime}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension function call fails and finishes execution. The suffix indicates the exact bucket the function is in. See also Extensions.Functions.FailedTotalExecutionTime. {ExtensionFunctionExecutionTime}

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.FailedTotalExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time it took to execute an extension function that failed from the time the extension function is called to the time the function responds. Note that since some extension functions are inherently slow (anything that requires user interaction, for instance), this is not a definitive source for function performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.HandleResponseElapsedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to handle a response for an extension API request. Recorded on the renderer side once we receive the response IPC from the browser and have deserialized the arguments and passed them to the JS context. Only recorded if the response is successfully handled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.StartRequestElapsedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to start an extension API request. Recorded on the renderer side after we perform JS pre-processing, but includes all serialization and dispatching. Only recorded if the request is successfully dispatched.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.SucceededTime{ExtensionFunctionExecutionTime}
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension function call succeeds and finishes execution. The suffix indicates the exact bucket the function is in. See also Extensions.Functions.SucceededTotalExecutionTime. {ExtensionFunctionExecutionTime}

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.SucceededTotalExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time it took to execute an extension function that succeeded from the time the extension function is called to the time the function responds. Note that since some extension functions are inherently slow (anything that requires user interaction, for instance), this is not a definitive source for function performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.SynchronousExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The synchronous amount of time an extension function takes. Note that many extension functions run asynchronously; see also Extensions.Functions.[Succeeded|Failed]TotalExecutionTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.WebUICalls
histogram.summary: Recorded when a WebUI context calls an extension API. Recorded once per function call. See also Extensions.Functions.WebUIUntrustedCalls, Extensions.Functions.ComponentExtensionCalls and Extensions.Functions.ExtensionCalls.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.WebUIUntrustedCalls
histogram.summary: Recorded when a WebUI context calls an extension API. Recorded once per function call. See also Extensions.Functions.WebUICalls, Extensions.Functions.ComponentExtensionCalls and Extensions.Functions.ExtensionCalls.

histogram.name: Extensions.GoogleDocOffline.AvailabilityOnResourceRequest
histogram.summary: This histogram records requests to use resources from Google Docs Offline extension, along with whether the extension has been available or not and the request has been done from incognito mode or not. Note that this request is double counted for the imports.

histogram.name: Extensions.Greylist.Disabled
histogram.summary: Emits the Extension::Location of a newly-disabled greylisted extension. Logged when SafeBrowsingVerdictHandler greylists and disables an installed extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.Greylist.Enabled
histogram.summary: Emits the Extension::Location of an extension that was ungreylisted. Logged when SafeBrowsingVerdictHandler ungreylists and enables an installed extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_AutoDisable3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument AutoDisable. For Sync users, this may be reported for each device, depending on whether the Sync update or the extension auto-update happen first.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_Install3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was installed. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Install. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_InstallAbort3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_InstallCancel3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_Load3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was loaded (which happens at profile open or extension install). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Load.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_ReEnable3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnable.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_ReEnableAbort3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and manual user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_ReEnableCancel3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_Uninstall3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Uninstall. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_WebStoreInstall3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstall. Contrary to the more-general HasPermissions_Install3 histogram, this one is NOT reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_WebStoreInstallCancel3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.HomepageOverrides
histogram.summary: The number of enabled extensions with a homepage override specified in their manifest. Recorded once per profile at profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppLaunchContainer
histogram.summary: Records the container used for a hosted app launch, when the app is launched. The definition of 'launch' for the purposes of this histogram is different to that used for the launch type histograms. This definition is less inclusive, for example it does not include navigations to the hosted app due to normal browsing, which the other definition does include. This definition could be thought of more as explicit launches via a launch surface such as the app launcher, chrome://apps, or a shortcut.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostPermissions.GrantedAccess
histogram.summary: Records the host permissions access for a enabled extension as a result of the RuntimeHostPermissions feature. Recorded once per extension at profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostPermissions.GrantedAccessForBroadRequests
histogram.summary: Records the host permissions access for each enabled extension that specifies a host permission that matches an effective TLD. Recorded once per extension at profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostPermissions.GrantedAccessForTargetedRequests
histogram.summary: Records the host permissions access for each enabled extension that specifies hosts, but has no host permission that matches an effective TLD. Recorded once per extension at profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.IncognitoAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been allowed in incognito, and were, for users that have at least one extension that could have been allowed. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.IncognitoNotAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.IncognitoNotAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been allowed in incognito, but weren't, for users that have at least one extension that could have been allowed. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.IncognitoAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.InitPrefGetExtensionsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the GetExtensions call within ExtensionPrefs::InitPrefStore.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectCssTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time for a CSS file to be injected into a page.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectedScriptExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to execute all scripts for one location within an extension. Recorded every time content scripts injected by extensions are executed. Unlike Extensions.InjectScriptTime, this includes execution time of asynchronously injected scripts.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_BlockingScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of blocking scripts injected at document end by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document end by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts at document end by extensions. Not reported if scripts are executed asynchronously.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_BlockingScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of blocking scripts injected at document idle by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document idle by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts at document idle by extensions. Not reported if scripts are executed asynchronously.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_BlockingScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of blocking scripts injected at document start by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_CssCount
histogram.summary: Number of css files injected by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document start by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject css/scripts at document start by extensions. Not reported if scripts are executed asynchronously.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallFrictionDialogAction
histogram.summary: Action taken in the extension install friction dialog displayed to Enhanced Safe Browsing users before installing an extension that is not included in the Safe Browsing CRX allowlist.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.TimeToCancel
histogram.summary: Time from first display of the extension installation prompt until the user aborts the installation through clicking the cancel button or dismissing the dialog.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.TimeToInstall
histogram.summary: Time from first display of the extension installation prompt until the user accepts the installation. Will always be greater than 500ms as the install option is enabled after that time has elapsed.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.Type2
histogram.summary: Type of the extension install prompt displayed when an extension installation is triggered. Replaced Extensions.InstallPrompt.Type 2019-07.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPromptExperiment.ShowDetails
histogram.summary: Actions on the show details link grouped by action type when the install prompt trial is running.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPromptExperiment.ShowPermissions
histogram.summary: Actions on the show permissions link grouped by action type when the install prompt trial is running.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallSource
histogram.summary: Installs grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallType
histogram.summary: Installs grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstanceID.GetToken.OptionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of options provided to the GetToken request. Recorded when the extension has made a call to chrome.instanceID.getToken().

histogram.name: Extensions.IsRenderedIconSufficientlyVisibleTime
histogram.summary: The amount of elapsed time taken to render an icon against a specified background color and determine whether it would be visible to the user. Recorded every time the analysis code is called.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAll
histogram.summary: The number of extensions and themes loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllComponentTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all component extensions at profile open. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllTime2
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all non-component extensions at profile open and record metrics. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadApp
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAppExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAppUser
histogram.summary: The number of user-installed apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadBrowserAction
histogram.summary: The number of browser action extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadCreationFlags
histogram.summary: The creation flags of all extensions loaded at profile open grouped by Extension::InitFromValueFlags.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtension
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtensionExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtensionUser
histogram.summary: The number of user-installed extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed extensions and apps loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadHostedApp
histogram.summary: The number of hosted apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadNoExtensionAction
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that had neither a page nor browser action specified in their manifest. Recorded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadOffStoreItems
histogram.summary: The number of enabled extensions or apps the user has installed that do not update from the Chrome Web Store. Recorded during profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPackagedApp
histogram.summary: The number of legacy packaged apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPlatformApp
histogram.summary: The number of platform apps loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadTheme
histogram.summary: The number of themes loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadType
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at profile open grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadUserScript
histogram.summary: The number of converted user scripts loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LockedFullscreenStateRequest
histogram.summary: Records requests to enter or exit locked fullscreen mode through extension APIs. Used only on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Extensions.Management_Refresh
histogram.summary: Measures how long ExtensionManagement::Refresh takes. This reloads all enterprise-related policies for all extensions, and is called both at startup and any time the enterprise policy changes.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchSuccessRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchSuccessRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestIconSetIconWasVisibleForPacked
histogram.summary: Reports whether an icon that's specified in the manifest is considered visible by our icon analysis code. This stat is only for packed extensions, which we check dynamically when the icon is requested. The stat is emitted the first time the default icon is requested, since we cache the icon that's selected.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestIconSetIconWasVisibleForPackedRendered
histogram.summary:
Reports whether an icon that's specified in the manifest is considered visible by our icon analysis code. This stat is only for packed extensions, which we check dynamically when the icon is requested. The stat is emitted the first time the default icon is requested, since we cache the icon that's selected.
This replaces the previous stat, ManifestIconSetIconWasVisibleForPacked, due to a change to our analysis algorithm. The new algorithm renders the icon against the toolbar background color and determines how visible the resulting pixels are.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestIconSetIconWasVisibleForUnpacked
histogram.summary: Reports whether loading an icon declarated in the extension's manifest icon set is considered visible by our icon analysis code. This stat is only for unpacked extensions, which we check at load time.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestIconSetIconWasVisibleForUnpackedRendered
histogram.summary:
Reports whether loading an icon declarated in the extension's manifest icon set is considered visible by our icon analysis code. This stat is only for unpacked extensions, which we check at load time.
This replaces the previous stat, ManifestIconSetIconWasVisibleForUnpacked, due to a change to our analysis algorithm. The new algorithm renders the icon against the toolbar background color and determines how visible the resulting pixels are.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadNeedsRelocalization
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is necessary to reload the mainfest because the locale has changed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadNotNeeded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is not necessary to reload the extension's manifest.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadUnpackedDir
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is necessary to reload the manifest because the extension is unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestVersion
histogram.summary: The manifest version of each loaded extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.ExtensionPortsCreated{ExtensionMessagingPortCreationTime}
histogram.summary: The number of ports created in a given script context at a specific time. Recorded once at the destruction of the script context (when no more ports could be created) if and only if at least one port was created in the context. Only includes ports to extension contexts (i.e., not ports created to tabs or native apps). {ExtensionMessagingPortCreationTime}

variant.name: .InBeforeUnload
variant.summary: Created during an event handler for the 'beforeunload' event.
variant.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

variant.name: .InUnload
variant.summary: Created during an event handler for the 'unload' event.
variant.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

variant.name: .Normal
variant.summary: Created during any time other than the 'unload' or 'beforeunload' handlers.
variant.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

variant.name: .Total
variant.summary: The total number of ports created.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.GetPortIdAsyncTime{ExtensionMessagingPortType}
Extensions.Messaging.GetPortIdSyncTime{ExtensionMessagingPortType}
Extensions.Messaging.MessageSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of a message sent from an extension using one of the messaging APIs (e.g. chrome.runtime.sendMessage). All message sizes are logged, but messages over 64 MB in size aren't sent.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.SetPortIdTime{ExtensionMessagingPortType}
Extensions.MimeHandlerViewEvents
histogram.summary: Reports the creation of MimeHandlerViews and usage of postMessage for cross and same origin resources.

histogram.name: Extensions.Navigation.Permissions
histogram.summary: Reports a subset of the permissions that are granted to enabled extensions running in the associated browser context at the time a navigation completes. Upon the main frame navigation completing each unique permission observed from all enabled extensions and a kTotal bucket will be recorded. For example, the kWebNavigation bucket divided by kTotal will yield the percentage of main frame navigations that had the kWebNavigation permission. This will be used to evaluate potential impact for BFCache.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelay
histogram.summary: Time that network requests were blocked due to extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of total lifetime a network request was blocked due to an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.NewTabPageOverrides
histogram.summary: The number of enabled extensions with a New Tab Page override specified in their manifest. Recorded once per profile at profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.NonWebstoreLocation
histogram.summary: The number of apps/extensions with a non-webstore update_url loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.NonWebStoreNewTabPageOverrides
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of non-WebStore extensions on startup that override the new tab page.

histogram.name: Extensions.NotAllowlistedDisabled
histogram.summary: The total number of disabled extensions that are not present in the Enhanced Safe Browsing CRX allowlist. Recorded for all users on profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.NotAllowlistedDisabledAndEsbUser
histogram.summary: The total number of disabled extensions that are not present in the Enhanced Safe Browsing CRX allowlist. Recorded for only for Enhanced Safe Browsing users on profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.NotAllowlistedEnabled
histogram.summary: The total number of enabled extensions that are not present in the Enhanced Safe Browsing CRX allowlist. Recorded for all users on profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.NotAllowlistedEnabledAndEsbUser
histogram.summary: The total number of enabled extensions that are not present in the Enhanced Safe Browsing CRX allowlist. Recorded for only for Enhanced Safe Browsing users on profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument AutoDisable. For Sync users, this may be reported for each device, depending on whether the Sync update or the extension auto-update happen first.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Install. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded (which happens at profile open or extension install). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Load.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnable.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and manual user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Uninstall. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstall. Contrary to the more-general Permissions_Install3 histogram, this one is NOT reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.PopupCreateTime
histogram.summary: The time taken between a user clicking on a button to open a popup, and the popup finishing loading its initial URL. This is a good way to measure the UI responsiveness of extension popups. It will be strictly larger than Extensions.PopupLoadTime2, which only measures the time it takes to load - there may be a delay between clicking and starting to load, for example, if the popup's host got caught in a queue.

histogram.name: Extensions.PopupLoadTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken for an extension popup to load its initial URL. This may not include the time taken for an extension process to start, if the extension already has a background page running. It does not necessarily correlate with the amount of time since the popup was *clicked* either, since there may be a delay between the user clicking and the loading started. Extensions.PopupCreateTime measures this instead.

histogram.name: Extensions.PowerfulCount
histogram.summary: The number of extensions reported in chrome://management UI with powerful permissions. This number is recorded every time the user opens chrome://management UI.

histogram.name: Extensions.ProcessManagerStartupHostsTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken to start up persistent background pages for extensions in ExtensionProcessManager when the extension system notifies that it is ready. This version of the histogram does not include cases where the background page startup is deferred, which would have been logged as ~0ms startup in Extensions.ProcessManagerStartupHostsTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResetPermissionsIncrease
histogram.summary: Whether the DISABLE_PERMISSIONS_INCREASE disable reason was removed from an extension while checking for a permissions increase. Recorded during startup and on reload and update, for each extension that has the DISABLE_PERMISSIONS_INCREASE reason.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedDelta
histogram.summary: The difference in seconds between an extension resource's last modification time and its extension base directory's creation time. Recorded on each extension resource request if the difference is non-negative (i.e., the resource's last modification time is more recent than the directory's creation time.) For cases where the directory creation date is more recent, see Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedNegativeDelta instead.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedNegativeDelta
histogram.summary: The absolute difference in seconds between an extension resource's last modification time and extension base directory's creation time.
